Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a light-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is greyish in section, the interior is covered with a self-slip and remains of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink, the exterior is covered with a self-slip.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394796) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394796)
